Get an ALASCA object

ALASCA.Rd

ALASCA initializes an ALASCA model and returns an ALASCA object

ALASCA(
  df,
  formula,
  separateTimeAndGroup = TRUE,
  pAdjustMethod = NA,
  participantColumn = "ID",
  validate = FALSE,
  scaleFun = TRUE,
  forceEqualBaseline = FALSE,
  useSumCoding = FALSE,
  method = NA,
  stratificationVector = NA,
  minimizeObject = FALSE,
  plot.xlabel = "Time",
  doDebug = FALSE,
  nValFold = 7,
  nValRuns = 50,
  validateRegression = FALSE,
  validationMethod = "loo",
  validationObject = NA,
  validationParticipants = NA
)

Arguments

df

Data frame to be analyzed
formula

Regression model
separateTimeAndGroup

Logical: should time and group effect be separated?
pAdjustMethod

Method for correcting p values for multiple testing, see p.adjust.methods
participantColumn

String. Name of the column containing participant identification
validate

Logical. If TRUE, give estimates for robustness
scaleFun

If TRUE (default), each variable is scaled to unit SD and zero mean. If FALSE, no scaling is performed. You can also provide a custom scaling function that has the data frame df as input and output
forceEqualBaseline

Set to TRUE (default) to remove interaction between group and first time point
useSumCoding

Set to TRUE to use sum coding instead of contrast coding for group (defaults to FALSE)
method

Defaults to NA where method is either LM or LMM or Rfast, depending on whether your formula contains a random effect or not
stratificationVector

Vector of same length as df that specifies stratification groups during validation. Defaults to NA, where the group column is used.
minimizeObject

Logical. If TRUE, remove unnecessary clutter, optimize for validation
plot.xlabel

Defaults to "Time"
doDebug

Print what happens (default: FALSE)
nValFold

Partitions when validating
nValRuns

number of validation runs
validateRegression

Whether to validate regression predictions or not (only if validate is TRUE)
validationMethod

among loo (leave-one-out, default)
validationObject

Don't worry about me:)
validationParticipants

Don't worry about me:)

Value

An ALASCA object

Details

This function builds your ALASCA model. It needs a data frame containing at least a column identifying participants, a column called time contining time information, a column group containing group information, a column variable containing variable names, and a value column. In addition you need to specify the model you want, and whether you want to separate group and time effects (defaults to TRUE).

Examples

load("PE.Rdata")
model <- ALASCA(df = df, formula = value~time*group + (1|ID))

#> Will use linear mixed models!
#> Using group for stratification.
#> Scaling data...
#> Calculating  LMM  coefficients...
#> Finished calculating regression coefficients!
#> Calculating predictions from regression models...
#> Finished calculating predictions from regression models!
#> Calculating effect matrix
#> Finished calculating effect matrix!
